history.content: Please read through piazza answers, this topic has been made so, so many times

children.subject: Thanks for your advice! Can I ask why you broke them up in the way you did? Is it manageable to switch those up?
Ya go ahead and switch those up, the ordering was arbitrary.

The 2 EECS classes, 189, 161, 186, 162, none of these are "important as a new grad". You took the lower divs, that's important for a new grad. So no matter what you do, there will be no consequence :)

If you're not interested in ML, no need to take the 2 eecs classes and 189. If you're not sure if you will go into ML, you can still take 127 and 189. I don't know why you particularly want to take 161, 162, and 186, i'll just assume right now it's because you think they're important for a new grad.

I will only advise 2 techs a semester: 186 + 127, 161 + 126. You can self study 162 and 189 after.

history.content:
I am wondering if I can only take one of these which one I should take. I am not 100% sure if I plan on taking cs 189, but I have heard good things about both classes. I am a CS major and interested in ML but not sure if i will follow that path and I will be a senior. Also, is it worthwhile to take either of these classes if i don't end up taking ML?

On the flip side, I am not sure if I should take either of these, or prioritize CS classes like 161 and 162. I am going to be a senior and took this semester off for an internship so I have not taken as many upper divs so don't have as much flexibility. I am not positive if I see myself doing ML in the future, but I have worked in ML for an internship and am slightly intimidated by Berkeley's class. I find ML very interesting and even if I am not an ML engineer it seems still important as a new graduate. 

I definitely want to take 161, and tempted to take 162. i also want to take w186, but I don't think I can fit all three of those and EECS 126/127 :) any advice or feedback on favorite classes / most useful would be much appreciated.
history.subject: Usefulness of eecs127 vs. eecs 126? useful still if not sure if im taking 189?
